Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of bald male cult follower wearing headdress. Head only. Mould-made and hollow. Traces of white (gypsum?) coating, with traces of red paint on skin and turquoise paint on headdress. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with grey core. Abundant fine gold mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Probably made in Naukratis. See late Ptolemaic parallel from Tell Atrib (Szymańska 2005, no.212). Szymańska, H. 2005, Terres cuites d’Athribis, Turnhout.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.592) (Phase 1)
